data.event: In 1939 poet Mark Van Doren wrote "The Hills of Little Cornwall", a short poem in which the beauties of the countryside were portrayed as seductive: The mind, eager for caresses, Lies down at its own risk in Cornwall; Cornwall was incorporated in May 1740, and was named after Cornwall, England.

In 1939 poet Mark Van Doren wrote "The Hills of Little Cornwall", a short poem in which the beauties of the countryside were portrayed as seductive: The mind, eager for caresses, Lies down at its own risk in Cornwall; Cornwall was incorporated in May 1740, and was named after Cornwall, England.
